ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: recorded lectures, but I was always present in class
Virtual seminar followed by a live lecture

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The syllabus is accurate in reflecting what was learned. One added skill was learning how to convey ideas concisely with the 100 word limit on question answers.
cognitive biases and how people think
Learned about current psychology research, thinking biases, and real-world applications of what we covered in lecture.
You learn many of the fundamental studies that are devoted to "thinking", a wide range of topics that are all very interesting.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The structure of the course was a great strength, every class is broken into a discussion section, a lecture section, and a short review quiz. A weekly short assignment paired with the review quiz allowed for guaranteed understanding and many opportunities for feedback and grades without any unnecessary burdens. The work load was very manageable and felt very worthwhile.

strengths: small classroom size
weakness: same type of work every week

Strengths: small class size facilitated interesting conversations, weekly assignments were straightforward, lectures were engaging

Weaknesses: Friday meeting time wasn't my favorite, sometimes went over scheduled time by a significant amount

The lecture and discussion are all very engaging and interesting, and you really do learn a lot. If I had to pick a flaw, it would be that the class size was too small, so the discussion could be limited.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: It was a privilege to be able to ask questions during the lecture, as her lectures are usually huge. The discussion was also a great way for us to consolidate the studies and use them.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: This class was great! I learned so much and would definitely recommend it to others.
Yes, the course is a great senior seminar to work on any area of interest for either the senior essay or final paper of the class.
Yes. Strongly recommend to anyone of any grade, of any level.
If you are a pscyhology major, yes take this class! It's a great senior seminar that isn't overwhelming at all.
Absolutely! Even if it's all online again, you'll want to take this class because this course will brighten your week.
